pullRequest.body:
Currently, the model with corners `I` is explicit in many (most?) differential geometry statements. However, when rewriting, or applying theorems, it can be inferred from the context 95% of the time. Therefore, we make it implicit in most statements: the rule of thumb is that in `variable` lines we should have `{I : ModelWithCorners ùïú E H}`, and use `variable (I) in` for definitions. 

This looks like a clear improvement to me, making proofs more readable and avoiding clutter. For the few cases where we need to provide it explicitly, named arguments work well.

No mathematical change at all, just arguments implicitness.

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [be28cdee1e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17687/commits/be28cdee1e4fbd456aed26435238949dabfe21db)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Thanks for the pointers to remaining `(I)`. I've added two changes, and decided that the other ones were natural as they are. It's completely possible that I've still overlooked some of them, of course !

Sorry for the delay. I keep meaning to return to this PR, and check if there are further places that should be modified in the same way. Finding time for this will take a few days, though. In the mean-time, I see no reason why this PR should not land already: I agree with all the changes in it; I might only suggest a few more. Thanks again for the PR!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11506141371/job/32029400358)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11506141371/job/32029400984)

This seems like a worthwhile trade-off. Thank you for doing this. The changes you're making look good to me! There are a few remaining `variable (I)` in the `Geometry/Manifold` directory: would you like to change/audit those as well?

(These go beyond this diff, for instance, there is one in `BumpFunction`, another in `ContMDiffMFDeriv`, and these are not all.)

This seems like a worthwhile trade-off. Thank you for doing this. The changes you're making look good to me! There are a few remaining `variable (I)` in the `Geometry/Manifold` directory: would you like to change/audit those as well?

(These go beyond this diff, for instance, there is one in `BumpFunction`, another in `ContMDiffMFDeriv`, and these are not all.)

This is an exception to the rule you're proposing in the PR description. Do you have a particular reason for it? Can you say more about why? (Or did you simply not want to make *that* change as well?)
Or is there something particular about *this* section?

Yes, it's because this specific section is about `I` as a map (not as a parameter in other statements): it says that `I` or its inverse are differentiable, so `I` has better be explicit so that we know what we talk about. Let me add a comment about this.

The current variable management in this file technically *works* - but I would find it clearer to flip the default: make `I` and `I'` implicit in the variable block, and explicit in each definition. What do you think?

Most things in this file are definitions, so `I` and `I'` would need to be made explicit for most statements. But still, I agree with you that it's clearer to follow an overall design, so I've made the change.

```suggestion
  have := hs.inter' <| hf.1 (extChartAt_source_mem_nhds (I := I') (f x))

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: make the model with corners implicit in differential geometry statements
